cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: All players and flying creatures suffer X damage.

cards.name: Ice Storm
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroys any one land.

cards.name: Instill Energy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.

rulings.text: If attached to an opponent’s creature, you can untap their creature during your turn.
Instill Energy’s untap ability will not untap the creature until it resolves. This means other spells and abilities can be used before it actually becomes untapped.

Any Auras (or other effects) which are on the creature that would cause it to not be untapped (or have a cost to be untapped) during untap step do not in any way hinder or imply a cost to use this card’s ability to untap once during the turn.

cards.originalText: You may untap target creature both during your untap phase and one additional time during your turn. Target creature may attack the turn it comes into play.

cards.name: Ironroot Treefolk
cards.flavor: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

cards.name: Kudzu
cards.text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it. That land's controller may attach Kudzu to a land of their choice.

rulings.text: You can move it to any other player’s land whenever you get to move it.
If Kudzu is destroyed directly, or the land is destroyed by a spell or ability, then Kudzu goes to the graveyard like any Aura would.
The controller of the destroyed land must attach it to another land if possible. If there are no valid choices, Kudzu is simply put into the graveyard.
Because the ability isn’t targeted, the controller of the destroyed land may attach it to a land that can’t be the target of abilities.

cards.originalText: When target land becomes tapped, it is destroyed. Unless that was the last land in play, Kudzu is not discarded; instead, the player whose land it just destroyed may place it on another land of his or her choice.

cards.name: Ley Druid
cards.text: {T}: Untap target land.
cards.flavor: After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

rulings.text: The land is untapped as a normal ability that goes on the stack. It is not a mana ability, so it can’t be used at times that only mana abilities can be used.

cards.originalText: Tap Druid to untap a land of your choice. This action can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Lifeforce
cards.text: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.
cards.originalText: oGoG: Destroy a black spell as it is being cast. This use may be played as an interrupt, and does not affect black cards already in play.

cards.name: Lifelace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes green. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to green. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

cards.name: Living Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on Living Artifact.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact. If you do, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: You can cast it targeting your opponent’s artifacts. The controller of the Aura (not the controller of the artifact) controls the Living Artifact ability.
Does not trigger on loss of life, just on damage.

cards.originalText: Put a counter on target artifact for each life you lose. During upkeep you may trade one counter for one life, but you can only trade in one counter each turn.

cards.name: Living Lands
cards.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Treat all forests in play as 1/1 creatures. Now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack. The living lands have no color; they are not considered green cards.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: Whenever the Llanowar Elves gather the fruits of their forest, they leave one plant of each type untouched, considering that nature's portion.
cards.originalText: Tap to add 1 green mana to your mana pool. This tap can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

rulings.text: Lure doesn’t give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that’s tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can’t block doesn’t block. If there’s a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn’t block if that cost isn’t paid.

cards.originalText: All creatures able to block target creature must do so. If a creature has the ability to block more than one creature, Lure does not prevent this. If there is more than one attacking creature with Lure, defender may choose which of them each defending creature blocks.

cards.name: Natural Selection
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle their library.

rulings.text: This is now targeted.

cards.originalText: Look at top three cards of any player's library. You may opt to rearrange those three cards or shuffle the entire library.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText: ooG Target creature regenerates.

cards.name: Regrowth
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText: Return any card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Scryb Sprites
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Shanodin Dryads
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the Dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.
cards.originalText: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Thicket Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the Basilisk's power.

rulings.text: Protection from Green does not stop the Basilisk’s ability because the ability is not targeted.

The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

cards.originalText: Any non-wall creature blocking Basilisk is destroyed, as is any creature blocked by Basilisk. Creatures destroyed this way deal their damage before dying.

cards.name: Timber Wolves
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a “band.” The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers’ damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Bands

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.originalText: All enchantments in play must be discarded.

cards.name: Tsunami
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.originalText: All islands in play are destroyed.

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.
cards.originalText: While Enchantress is in play, you may immediately draw a card from your library each time you cast an enchantment.

cards.name: Wall of Brambles
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.
cards.flavor: "What else, when chaos draws all forces inward to shape a single leaf." —Conrad Aiken
cards.originalText: ooG Regenerates

cards.name: Wall of Ice
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor:
"And through the drifts the snowy cliffs/ Did send a dismal sheen:/ Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken—/ The ice was all between."/
—Samuel Coleridge, *"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"*

cards.name: Wall of Wood
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: Everybody knows that to ward off trouble, you knock on wood. But usually it's better to make a wall out of the wood and let trouble do the knocking.

cards.name: Wanderlust
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Wanderlust does 1 damage to target creature's controller during upkeep.

cards.name: War Mammoth
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Web
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
cards.originalText: Target creature gains +0/+2 and can now block flying creatures, though it does not gain the power to fly.

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.

rulings.text: The additional mana is not an ability of the land and is not something the land can produce.

cards.originalText: When tapped, target land provides 1 green mana in addition to the mana it normally provides.

cards.name: Atraxa, Praetors' Voice
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, deathtouch, lifelink
At the beginning of your end step, proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)

rulings.text: As you proliferate, you can choose any players that have counters, including yourself.

You can choose any permanent that has a counter, including ones controlled by opponents. You can’t choose cards in any zone other than the battlefield, even if they have counters on them, such as suspended cards or a Lightning Storm on the stack.

You don’t have to choose every permanent or player that has a counter; you choose only the ones you want to add another counter to. Since “any number” includes zero, you don’t have to choose any permanents at all, and you don’t have to choose any players at all.
If a player or permanent chosen this way has multiple kinds of counters, only a single new counter is given. You choose which kind of counter to give that permanent or player as you proliferate.

Players can respond to the spell or ability whose effect includes proliferating. Once that spell or ability starts to resolve, however, and its controller chooses which permanents and players will get new counters, it’s too late for anyone to respond.

If a creature has +1/+1 counters and -1/-1 counters on it, state-based actions remove the same number of each so that it has only one of those kinds of counters on it. There won’t be any counters of the other kind to put onto it as you proliferate.

cards.name: Atraxa, Praetors' Voice
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, deathtouch, lifelink
At the beginning of your end step, proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)

rulings.text: As you proliferate, you can choose any players that have counters, including yourself.

You can choose any permanent that has a counter, including ones controlled by opponents. You can’t choose cards in any zone other than the battlefield, even if they have counters on them, such as suspended cards or a Lightning Storm on the stack.

You don’t have to choose every permanent or player that has a counter; you choose only the ones you want to add another counter to. Since “any number” includes zero, you don’t have to choose any permanents at all, and you don’t have to choose any players at all.
If a player or permanent chosen this way has multiple kinds of counters, only a single new counter is given. You choose which kind of counter to give that permanent or player as you proliferate.

Players can respond to the spell or ability whose effect includes proliferating. Once that spell or ability starts to resolve, however, and its controller chooses which permanents and players will get new counters, it’s too late for anyone to respond.

If a creature has +1/+1 counters and -1/-1 counters on it, state-based actions remove the same number of each so that it has only one of those kinds of counters on it. There won’t be any counters of the other kind to put onto it as you proliferate.

cards.name: Champion of Lambholt
cards.text:
Creatures with power less than Champion of Lambholt's power can't block creatures you control.
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of Lambholt.

rulings.text: Creatures with power less than Champion of Lambholt can’t block any creature you control, not just Champion of Lambholt.
Champion of Lambholt’s ability works even if it isn’t attacking.

The comparison of power is only done when blockers are declared. Increasing the power of a blocking creature (or decreasing the power of Champion of Lambholt) after this point won’t cause any creature to stop blocking or become unblocked.

cards.name: Doubling Season
cards.text:
If an effect would create one or more tokens under your control, it creates twice that many of those tokens instead.
If an effect would put one or more counters on a permanent you control, it puts twice that many of those counters on that permanent instead.

rulings.text: The tokens and counters that Doubling Season creates are exact copies of the kind of tokens and counters that were being created in the first place.
Doubling Season affects cards that “enter the battlefield with” a certain number of counters. Triskelion, for example, would enter the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it rather than three.

If there are two Doubling Seasons on the battlefield, then the number of tokens or counters is four times the original number. If there are three on the battlefield, then the number of tokens or counters is eight times the original number, and so on.

Planeswalkers will enter the battlefield with double the normal amount of loyalty counters. However, if you activate an ability whose cost has you put loyalty counters on a planeswalker, the number you put on isn’t doubled. This is because those counters are put on as a cost, not as an effect.

cards.name: Doubling Season
cards.text:
If an effect would create one or more tokens under your control, it creates twice that many of those tokens instead.
If an effect would put one or more counters on a permanent you control, it puts twice that many of those counters on that permanent instead.

rulings.text: The tokens and counters that Doubling Season creates are exact copies of the kind of tokens and counters that were being created in the first place.
Doubling Season affects cards that “enter the battlefield with” a certain number of counters. Triskelion, for example, would enter the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it rather than three.

If there are two Doubling Seasons on the battlefield, then the number of tokens or counters is four times the original number. If there are three on the battlefield, then the number of tokens or counters is eight times the original number, and so on.

Planeswalkers will enter the battlefield with double the normal amount of loyalty counters. However, if you activate an ability whose cost has you put loyalty counters on a planeswalker, the number you put on isn’t doubled. This is because those counters are put on as a cost, not as an effect.

cards.name: Reclamation Sage
cards.text: When Reclamation Sage enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: "What was once formed by masons, shaped by smiths, or given life by mages, I will return to the embrace of the earth."

cards.name: Aspect of Wolf
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+Y, where X is half the number of Forests you control, rounded down, and Y is half the number of Forests you control, rounded up.

rulings.text: The effect is continuously updated based on the number of Forests you control at any given time.

foreignNames.name: Wolfsblut
foreignNames.text: Stärke und Widerstandskraft der verzauberten Kreatur erhöhen sich um die Hälfte der Anzahl der Wälder, die Du im Spiel hast, wobei Du gegebenenfalls bei Stärke abrunden und bei Widerstandskraft aufrunden darfst.

cards.originalText: Target creature's power and toughness are increased by half the number of forests you have in play, rounding down for power and up for toughness.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

foreignNames.name: Paradiesvögel
foreignNames.text:
Können fliegen.
{T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um ein Mana einer beliebigen Farbe. Spiele diese Fähigkeit wie einen Unterbrechungs-zauber.

cards.originalText:
Flying
ocT: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Channel
cards.text: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {C}.

rulings.text: Once your life total is 0, you can’t pay any more life, even if you’ve somehow not lost the game yet.

foreignNames.name: Blutzoll
foreignNames.text: Bis zum Ende des Zuges kannst Du Deinen Manavorrat um farbloses Mana aufstocken -zum Preis von einem Lebenspunkt je farblosen Mana. Sprich diesen Bezahlungszusatz als Unterbrechungszauber. Effekte, die Schaden verhindern oder umleiten, können hier nicht angewendet werden, um den Verlust der Lebenspunkte zu verhindern.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, you may add colorless mana to your mana pool at a cost of 1 life per point of mana. These additions are played with the speed of an interrupt. Effects that prevent or redirect damage may not be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Cockatrice
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

rulings.text: The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

foreignNames.name: Wolpertinger
foreignNames.text:
Kann fliegen.
Vernichte am Ende eines Kampfes alle Kreaturen, die einen Wolpertinger geblockt haben oder von ihm geblockt wurden.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Any non-wall creature blocking Cockatrice is destroyed, as is any creature blocked by Cockatrice. Creatures destroyed in this way deal their damage before dying.

cards.name: Craw Wurm
cards.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

cards.name: Crumble
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: The spirits of Argoth grant new life to those who repent the folly of enslaving their labors to devices.

rulings.text: If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, the player does not gain any life.

foreignNames.name: Zahn der Zeit
foreignNames.text: Begrabe ein Artefakt. Dessen Beherrscher erhält Lebenspunkte in Höhe der Spruchkosten des Artefakts.

cards.originalText: Buries target artifact. Artifact's controller gains life points equal to target artifact's casting cost.

cards.name: Desert Twister
cards.text: Destroy target permanent.

foreignNames.name: Wüstensturm
foreignNames.text: Vernichte eine bleibende Karte im Spiel.

cards.originalText: Destroy any card in play.

cards.name: Elvish Archers
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"

foreignNames.name: Bogenschützen der Elfen
foreignNames.text: Haben Erstschlag

cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Fastbond
cards.text:
You may play any number of lands on each of your turns.
Whenever you play a land, if it wasn't the first land you played this turn, Fastbond deals 1 damage to you.

rulings.text: You take damage when you play a land using the “play a land” action. Such an action can be your regular “play a land”, one enabled by Fastbond, or ones enabled through other effects.
You do not take damage when you “put a land onto the battlefield” through the effect of a spell or ability.

foreignNames.name: Schöpfungskraft
foreignNames.text: Wenn Du an der Reihe bist, kannst Du so viele zusätzliche Länder ins Spiel bringen, wie Du willst. Die gewaltige Schöpfungskraft kostet Dich jedoch 1 Schadenspunkt für jedes zusätzlich ausgespielte Gelände.

cards.originalText: You may put as many lands into play as you want each turn. Fastbond does 1 damage to you for every land beyond the first that you play in a single turn.

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

foreignNames.name: Nebel
foreignNames.text: Keine Kreatur verursacht Schaden während dieses Angriffs.

cards.originalText: Creatures attack and block as normal, but none deal any damage or otherwise affect any creature as a result of an attack or block. All attacking creatures are still tapped. Play any time before attack damage is dealt.

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

foreignNames.name: Naturgewalten
foreignNames.text:
Verursacht Trampelschaden.
Zahle während Deiner Versorgungsphase GGGG oder die Naturgewalten fügen Dir 8 Schadenspunkte zu.

cards.originalText:
Trample
You must pay oGoGoGoG during your upkeep or Force of Nature does 8 damage to you. You may still attack with Force of Nature even if you failed to pay the upkeep.

cards.name: Fungusaur
cards.text: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Rather than sheltering her young, the female Fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

rulings.text: If more than one creature damages it at one time, it only gets one counter.

foreignNames.name: Fungusaurus
foreignNames.text: Der Fungusaurus erhält am Ende eines Spielzuges, in der er verletzt, aber nicht getötet wurde, eine +1/+1-Marke.

cards.originalText: At the end of any turn during which Fungusaur was damaged but not destroyed, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Gaea's Liege
cards.text:
As long as Gaea's Liege isn't attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control. As long as Gaea's Liege is attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests defending player controls.
{T}: Target land becomes a Forest until Gaea's Liege leaves the battlefield.

rulings.text: When being declared as an attacker, use the “not attacking” power and toughness. It only changes after declaration is complete.
The activated ability doesn’t affect whether the land is basic or not. It overwrites any other land types. Being a Forest gives the affected land the ability “{T}: Add {G}.”
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

foreignNames.name: Gaeas Vasall
foreignNames.text:
Stärke und Widerstandskraft des Vasallen entsprechen der Anzahl der Wälder, die der Beherrscher im Spiel hat; doch wenn Gaeas Vasall angreift, dann entsprechen seine Stärke und Widerstandskraft der Anzahl der Wälder, die der angegriffene Spieler im Spiel hat.
{T}: Verwandle ein beliebiges Land in einen Wald. Diese Verwandlung hält solange an, bis Gaeas Vasall das Spiel verläßt.

cards.originalText: ocT: Turn any one land into a basic forest. Mark changed lands with counters, removing the counters when Gaea's Liege leaves play. Gaea's Liege has power and toughness equal to the number of forests controller has in play; when it's attacking, they are equal to the number of forests defending player has in play.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

foreignNames.name: Riesenwuchs
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält +3/+3 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

cards.originalText: Target creature gains +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

foreignNames.name: Riesenspinne
foreignNames.text: Kann fliegende Kreaturen blocken.

cards.originalText: Does not fly, but can block flying creatures.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

foreignNames.name: Hurrikan
foreignNames.text: Der Hurrikan fügt allen Spielern und allen fliegenden Kreaturen X Schadenspunkte zu.

cards.originalText: All players and flying creatures suffer X damage.

cards.name: Instill Energy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.

rulings.text: If attached to an opponent’s creature, you can untap their creature during your turn.
Instill Energy’s untap ability will not untap the creature until it resolves. This means other spells and abilities can be used before it actually becomes untapped.

Any Auras (or other effects) which are on the creature that would cause it to not be untapped (or have a cost to be untapped) during untap step do not in any way hinder or imply a cost to use this card’s ability to untap once during the turn.

foreignNames.name: Energieschub
foreignNames.text:
Die verzauberte Kreatur kann bereits in der Runde, in der sie beschworen wurde, angreifen.
0: Enttappe die durch Energieschub verzauberte Kreatur während Deines Zuges. Du kannst diese Eigenschaft aber nur einmal pro Zug anwenden.

cards.originalText: You may untap target creature one additional time during your turn. Target creature may also attack the turn it comes into play.

cards.name: Ironroot Treefolk
cards.flavor: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it. That land's controller may attach Kudzu to a land of their choice.

rulings.text: You can move it to any other player’s land whenever you get to move it.
If Kudzu is destroyed directly, or the land is destroyed by a spell or ability, then Kudzu goes to the graveyard like any Aura would.
The controller of the destroyed land must attach it to another land if possible. If there are no valid choices, Kudzu is simply put into the graveyard.
Because the ability isn’t targeted, the controller of the destroyed land may attach it to a land that can’t be the target of abilities.

foreignNames.name: Kudzu
foreignNames.text: Wird das verzauberte Land getappt, so wird es vernichtet. Kudzu wird solange nicht abgelegt, wie sich noch Land im Spiel befindet. Stattdessen kann der Spieler, dessen Land gerade vernichtet wurde, Kudzu auf ein beliebiges anderes Land im Spiel legen.

cards.originalText: When target land becomes tapped, it is destroyed. Unless that was the last land in play, Kudzu is not discarded; instead, the player whose land it just destroyed may place it on any other land in play.

cards.name: Ley Druid
cards.text: {T}: Untap target land.
cards.flavor: After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

rulings.text: The land is untapped as a normal ability that goes on the stack. It is not a mana ability, so it can’t be used at times that only mana abilities can be used.

foreignNames.name: Leydruide
foreignNames.text: {T}: Enttappe ein Land. Spiele diese Eigenschaft wie einen Unterbrechungszauber

cards.originalText: ocT: Untap a land of your choice. This ability is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Lifeforce
cards.text: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.

foreignNames.name: Lebenskraft
foreignNames.text: {G}{G}: Neutralisiere einen schwarzen Spruch. Spiele diese Eigenschaft wie einen Unterbrechungszauber.

cards.originalText: oGoG: Counter a black spell as it is being cast. This use is played as an interrupt and does not affect black cards already in play.

cards.name: Lifelace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes green. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

foreignNames.name: Lebensgewebe
foreignNames.text: Die Farbe einer entweder im Spiel befindlichen oder gerade gespielten Karte verändert sich in Grün. Völlig unberührt davon bleiben der Gebrauch einer bestimmten Fähigkeit und die Kosten der Heraufbeschwörung, des Tappens oder der Versorgung der veränderten Karte.

cards.originalText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to green. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

cards.name: Living Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on Living Artifact.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact. If you do, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: You can cast it targeting your opponent’s artifacts. The controller of the Aura (not the controller of the artifact) controls the Living Artifact ability.
Does not trigger on loss of life, just on damage.

foreignNames.name: Lebendes Artefakt
foreignNames.text:
Lege eine Lebens-Spielmarke auf das Artefakt für jeden Lebenspunkt, den Du verlierst.
0: Entferne während Deiner Versorgungsphase eine Lebensmarke vom Artefakt und gewinne einen Lebenspunkt zurück. Du kannst während jeder Deiner Versorgungsphasen nur eine Lebensmarke umwandeln.

cards.originalText: Put a counter on target artifact for each life you lose. During your upkeep you may trade one counter for one life, but you can only trade in one counter during each of your upkeeps.

cards.name: Living Lands
cards.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

foreignNames.name: Erwachen der Wälder
foreignNames.text: Alle Wälder werden zu grünen 1/1 Kreaturen. Sie zählen immer noch als Länder, und Du kannst sie für Mana tappen - allerdings nicht in dem Zug, in dem sie ins Spiel kommen.

cards.originalText: Treat all forests in play as 1/1 creatures. Now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: Whenever the Llanowar Elves gather the fruits of their forest, they leave one plant of each type untouched, considering that nature's portion.

foreignNames.name: Llanowarelfen
foreignNames.text:
{T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um G.
Spiele diese Eigenschaft wie einen Unterbrechungszauber.

cards.originalText: ocT: Add oG to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

rulings.text: Lure doesn’t give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that’s tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can’t block doesn’t block. If there’s a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn’t block if that cost isn’t paid.

foreignNames.name: Köder
foreignNames.text: Alle Kreaturen, die die verzauberte Kreatur blocken können, müssen dies tun. Köder verhindert nicht, dass Kreaturen, die die Eigenschaft haben, mehrere Kreaturen zu blocken, dies auch tun. Wenn der Blocker gezwungen ist, mehr Kreaturen zu blocken, als ihn möglich ist, darf der Verteidiger sich aussuchen, welche der Kreaturen geblockt wird, doch müssen so viele Kreaturen wie erlaubt geblockt werden.

cards.originalText: All creatures able to block target creature must do so. If a creature has the ability to block more than one creature, Lure does not prevent this. If there is more than one attacking creature with Lure, defender may choose which of them each defending creature blocks.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

foreignNames.name: Regeneration
foreignNames.text: {G}: Regeneriere die durch diesen Zauber verzauberte Kreatur.

cards.originalText: ooG Target creature regenerates.

cards.name: Regrowth
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

foreignNames.name: Neues Leben
foreignNames.text: Hole von Deinem Friedhof eine Karte Deiner Wahl wieder in Dein Blatt.

cards.originalText: Bring any card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Scryb Sprites
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

foreignNames.name: Waldfeen
foreignNames.text: Können fliegen.

cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Shanodin Dryads
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the Dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

foreignNames.name: Dryaden aus dem Shanodin
foreignNames.text: Waldtarnung

cards.originalText: Forestwalk

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.

foreignNames.name: Lebensquelle
foreignNames.text: Du oder ein anderer Spieler Deiner Wahl erhält X Lebenspunkte dazu.

cards.originalText: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Thicket Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the Basilisk's power.

rulings.text: Protection from Green does not stop the Basilisk’s ability because the ability is not targeted.

The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

foreignNames.name: Buschbasilisk
foreignNames.text: Vernichte am Ende eines Kampfes alle Kreaturen, die den Basilisken geblockt haben oder von ihm geblockt worden.

cards.originalText: Any non-wall creature blocking Basilisk is destroyed, as is any creature blocked by Basilisk. Creatures destroyed this way deal their damage before dying.

cards.name: Timber Wolves
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a “band.” The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers’ damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

foreignNames.name: Waldwölfe
foreignNames.text: Bündnisfähigkeit

cards.originalText: Bands

cards.name: Titania's Song
cards.text: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

foreignNames.name: Titanias Lied
foreignNames.text: Alle Nicht-Kreatur-Artefakte im Spiel verlieren ihre regulären Fähigkeiten und verwandeln sich in Artefaktkreaturen mit Stärke und Widerstandskraft in Höhe ihrer Zauberkosten. Sobald die Verzauberung das Spiel verlässt, verwandeln sich die Artefakte wieder in das zurück, was sie vor der Verzauberung waren. Dies geschieht vor der Enttap-Phase des nächsten Zuges.

cards.originalText: All non-creature artifacts in play lose all their usual abilities and become artifact creatures with toughness and power both equal to their casting costs. If Titania's Song leaves play, artifacts return to normal just before the untap phase of the next turn.

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.

foreignNames.name: Seelenruhe
foreignNames.text: Alle Verzauberungen verlieren ihre Wirkung und gehen auf den Friedhof.

cards.originalText: All enchantments in play must be discarded.

cards.name: Tsunami
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.

foreignNames.name: Tsunami
foreignNames.text: Vernichte alle Inseln im Spiel.

cards.originalText: All islands in play are destroyed.

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.

foreignNames.name: Blütenzauberin
foreignNames.text: 0: Ziehe eine Karte, wenn Du eine Verzauberung erfolgreich gesprochen hast. Du kannst diesen Effekt allerdings pro Verzauberung nur einmal nutzen.

cards.originalText: While Enchantress is in play, you may immediately draw a card from your library each time you cast an enchantment.

cards.name: Wall of Brambles
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.
cards.flavor: "What else, when chaos draws all forces inward to shape a single leaf." —Conrad Aiken

foreignNames.name: Dornenmauer
foreignNames.text: {G}: Regeneration

cards.originalText: ooG Regenerates.

cards.name: Wall of Ice
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor:
"And through the drifts the snowy cliffs Did send a dismal sheen: Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken— The ice was all between."
—Samuel Coleridge, *"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"*

cards.name: Wall of Wood
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: Everybody knows that to ward off trouble, you knock on wood. But usually it's better to make a wall out of the wood and let trouble do the knocking.

cards.name: Wanderlust
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.

foreignNames.name: Wanderlust
foreignNames.text: Wanderlust fügt dem Beherrscher der verzauberten Kreatur während seiner Versorgungsphase 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText: Wanderlust does 1 damage to target creature's controller during his or her upkeep.

cards.name: War Mammoth
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

foreignNames.name: Kriegsmammut
foreignNames.text: Verursacht Trampelschaden

cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Web
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

foreignNames.name: Spinnennetz
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält +0/+2 und kann nun auch Kreaturen mit Flugfähigkeit blocken.

cards.originalText: Target creature gains +0/+2 and can now block flying creatures, though it does not gain flying ability.

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.

rulings.text: The additional mana is not an ability of the land and is not something the land can produce.

foreignNames.name: Wildwuchs
foreignNames.text: Wildwuchs erhöht Deinen Manavorrat um ein zusätzliches {G}, sobald Du das verzauberte Land tappst, um damit Mana zu erzeugen.

cards.originalText: Whenever the usual mana is drawn from target land, Wild Growth provides an extra oG.

cards.name: Aspect of Wolf
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+Y, where X is half the number of Forests you control, rounded down, and Y is half the number of Forests you control, rounded up.

rulings.text: The effect is continuously updated based on the number of Forests you control at any given time.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Carnivorous Plant
cards.text: Defender

cards.name: Channel
cards.text: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {C}.

rulings.text: Once your life total is 0, you can’t pay any more life, even if you’ve somehow not lost the game yet.

cards.name: Cockatrice
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

rulings.text: The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

cards.name: Crumble
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, the player does not gain any life.

cards.name: Desert Twister
cards.text: Destroy target permanent.

cards.name: Elven Riders
cards.text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don’t actually have Flying, so they can’t block this.

cards.name: Elvish Archers
cards.text: First strike

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

cards.name: Fungusaur
cards.text: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

rulings.text: If more than one creature damages it at one time, it only gets one counter.

cards.name: Gaea's Liege
cards.text:
As long as Gaea's Liege isn't attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control. As long as Gaea's Liege is attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests defending player controls.
{T}: Target land becomes a Forest until Gaea's Liege leaves the battlefield.

rulings.text: When being declared as an attacker, use the “not attacking” power and toughness. It only changes after declaration is complete.
The activated ability doesn’t affect whether the land is basic or not. It overwrites any other land types. Being a Forest gives the affected land the ability “{T}: Add {G}.”
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.
